question: Question_07_(b)
statement:
The equation

\[\begin{bmatrix} 1 & 0\\ 0& 1\\ 1& 1 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} x_{1}\\ x_{2} \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 1\\ 2\\ 3 \end{bmatrix}\]

has no solution.

\textbf{(b)} Explain in what way the \emph{least squares} solution is
the best possible approximation to a solution.
sols:
The \emph{least squares solution} is the best possible approximation
because it minimizes the Euclidean distance, i.e. the solution where
\emph{Ax} that is closest to \emph{b}.
